com.g3d.app
Class Application

java.lang.Object
  com.g3d.app.Application
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimpleApplication
public class Application
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

The Application class represents an instance of a real-time 3D rendering application. Typically the rendering is controlled with a SceneManager implementation.

Constructor Detail

Application

public Application()
Create a new instance of Application.

Method Detail

setSceneManager

public void setSceneManager(SceneManager manager)
Set the SceneManager to control rendering and updating of the application's scene and real-time state respectively. It is not recommended to change the SceneManager while the application is running.

Parameters:
manager - The scene manager to set

setSettings

public void setSettings(DisplaySettings settings)
Set the display settings to define the display created. Examples of display parameters include display pixel width and height, color bit depth, z-buffer bits, antialiasing samples, and update freqency.

Parameters:
settings - The settings to set.

getRenderer

public Renderer getRenderer()
Returns:
The renderer for the application, or null if was not started yet.

getContext

public G3DContext getContext()
Returns:
The display context for the application, or null if was not started yet.

getCamera

public Camera getCamera()
Returns:
The camera for the application, or null if was not started yet.

init

public void init()
Initializes the Application, by creating a display and default camera. If display settings are not specified, a default 640x480 display is created. Default values are used for the camera; perspective projection with 45° field of view, with near and far values 1 and 1000 units respectively.

run

public void run()
Begins the main loop for the application, invoking the set SceneManager for initialization first, then running update and render calls each frame. Note that control will not be returned to the calling code until the display is closed.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
